metadata.title: CVE-2016-9854 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in phpMyAdmin. By calling some scripts that arepart of phpMyAdmin in an unexpected way, it is possible to triggerphpMyAdmin to display a PHP error message which contains the full path ofthe directory where phpMyAdmin is installed. During an execution timeout inthe export functionality, the errors containing the full path of thedirectory of phpMyAdmin are written to the export file. All 4.6.x versions(prior to 4.6.5), and 4.4.x versions (prior to 4.4.15.9) are affected. ThisCVE is for the json_decode issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.5.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.5.1-1').
